page.title: 08FARMING SPETISBURY CHARLTON
page.content: The ten farms in this area are all dairy farms. Eight of these also grow corn for their own animal feed and to sell to large corn merchants. The size of farms range from 2,OOO acres to 4O acres. Nowadays dairy farming is intensive - cows (mostly friesian) calve at approx. 2 years, and continue to reproduce until their 12th year. The corn grown here is mainly barley and wheat, less of oats and maize. Cash crops are Christmas trees, corn on the cob and potatoes. Other crops grown are for cattle fodder - namely, turnips, kale, rape and mustard. The soil here is mostly chalk-of which the high acidity content requires lime to create a good balance for grass growth (lime being obtained from the hills surrounding Shillingstone).
